content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I really enjoyed solving this nice puzzle. It is original, the category is well chosen, and the statement is quite clear. It's great for me.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I found the forest-growing coding puzzle to be interesting. It was fun to figure out the optimal planting location to maximize tree growth within the given rules. I would be curious to see a more challenging version of the puzzle with additional rules or constraints.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Really nice puzzle! I thoroughly enjoyed coding up a solution and I think Medium is the right category. This is the kind of puzzle that makes me excited to see what kinds of solutions other people come up with. I don't know how CG chooses puzzles for the weekly community challenge, but I vote for this puzzle to be selected!

The answer to validator "One tree" should be 23 and not 22, with the seed being planted at (2,0) or any of the symmetrical points.

I didn't fully read your answer so I can't suggest you a fix but there seems to be a bug in your noNeedToPlant logic that is discarding this option. Just switching this line:

if( MAP_Tiles_Start_With_Trees[i][j].noNeedToPlant == false )

to 

if( true )

will indeed yield 23.


On another note, I'd probably avoid the adult keyword and just talk about seeds / trees*. Maybe it's just me but I spent 5 mins to realize that I had to count only the "Y" and not "Y" + "X" (since I assumed the "X" was also considered a tree because of this adult thingy)

* something like:

-Seeds need 10 years to become a tree.
-Trees produce 4 seeds around them after one year.
-Trees may be already present on your land, they will produce seed after one year too.

Interesting puzzle!

Goal section
* Please format the grid examples using the `monospace syntax`.

Input/Output/Constraints sections
* Please change h to H.
* Please format W, H and N as [[variables]].
* Please format Y and . as {{constants}}.
* Please format all the line numbers in <<bold>>, e.g. <<Line 1>>.

Cases
* Suggest to change the land size of No Trees Validator so that it is different from No Trees Test.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement (e.g. "write answer", "write number of trees").

Thanks.

Any advices or tests are welcomed,
If there is something unclear in the description please tell me :)

I had a hard Time with ordering the grid and it was not satisfying in the end, I will try the monospace syntax as soon as possible.
And I will do the others changes as you have suggested as well.
Thank you very Much :)

I though to remove this condition this night during my sleep, I had removed possible answer because trees would have grown at theses places in the end. But you are right, best place Can be on those places like for the "one tree" case, 23 is Indeed the solution.
I will remove adulte  word.
Thank you very Much for your help

Thank you very much for your support, it makes me happy if you enjoyed it :)
I wanted to add some parameters like wind that will disperse the seeds
Or sun that will make seeds growing faster
Maybe for a difficult mode later, but only if this one get approved, and it doesn't seem to be frequent as I look the others contribution.
I don't know what is the weekly community challenge?

Hey, thank you very much for your comment and approbation,
Yes like I said below I was thinking to add parameters like wind to disperse seed and sun direction where trees make shadow onto others reducing the speed grow.
If this one is validated I will create a difficult version, with maybe something more than just the add of new parameters.

Like different kind of trees.

I love your ideas for making a hard version of the puzzle!

On the main menu, keep an eye on Events -> Upcoming. If history repeats itself, CG will eventually come back to having a community puzzle that is selected for a week. At the end of week, the participants vote on which solutions they like best.

I have registered  for notifications
Thank you !!

Ah, I see what you mean. Maybe using ``` is better? For example:
```.....
.X...
.....
.....
....Y```

Input section
* Please format "Next [[H]] lines" in <<bold>> too.

Constraints section
* Please format W and H as [[variables]].

Thanks :)

For all the grids it takes some place in the description but it is important to show the growth of trees, it is better than before anyway, better aligned.
All changes done thank you :)
